Peaks corresponding genome version conversion

Source: R/weight.R
liftOverPeaks.Rd

The function convert genomic coordinates based on provided peaks.SCEGHIC provides the bulk average Hi-C genome versions of hg19 and mm10, so require genome coordinate conversion for hg38 and mm10.

Usage

liftOverPeaks(split_peaks, genome)

Arguments

split_peaks

Peaks of genome coordinate conversion.

genome

String indicating the name of the genome assembly.It can be either "hg38" or "mm9".

Value

A data.frame with peaks after genome coordinate conversion.

Examples

peaks <- c(
  "chr2-973888-974755", "chr2-3195868-3196264", "chr2-3242398-3243508", "chr2-6863856-6866834", "chr2-6913141-6914394",
  "chr2-6924663-6924972", "chr2-6999095-6999554", "chr2-7007713-7008819", "chr2-7083945-7084032", "chr2-7097148-7098029"
)
split_peaks <- do.call("rbind", strsplit(as.character(peaks), "-", fixed = TRUE))
peakinfo <- liftOverPeaks(split_peaks, "hg38")
head(peakinfo)
#>    chr   start     end                 peak  midpoint
#> 1 chr2  969574  970441   chr2_973888_974755  970007.5
#> 2 chr2 3199639 3200035 chr2_3195868_3196264 3199837.0
#> 3 chr2 3246169 3247279 chr2_3242398_3243508 3246724.0
#> 4 chr2 7003987 7006965 chr2_6863856_6866834 7005476.0
#> 5 chr2 7053272 7054525 chr2_6913141_6914394 7053898.5
#> 6 chr2 7064794 7065103 chr2_6924663_6924972 7064948.5
